00021 //gcode stuff for gcode2model

00030 bool gcode2Model::interpret ( QString file )
00031 {
00032         QString ipath = "/opt/src/emc2/trunk/";
00033         QString interp = ipath + "bin/rs274";
00034         QString iparm = ipath + "configs/sim/sim_mm.var\n";
00035         QString itool = ipath + "configs/sim/sim_mm.tbl\n";
00036         QProcess toCanon;
00037         bool foundEOF;
00038         toCanon.start(interp,QStringList(file));
00039         /**************************************************
00040         Apparently, QProcess::setReadChannel screws with waitForReadyRead() and canReadLine()
00041         So, we just fly blind and assume that there are no errors when we navigate
00042         the interp's "menu", and that it requires no delays.
00043         **************************************************/
00044 
00045         //now give the interpreter the data it needs
00046         toCanon.write("2\n");   //set parameter file
00047         toCanon.write(iparm.toAscii());
00048         toCanon.write("3\n");   //set tool table file
00049         toCanon.write(itool.toAscii());
00050         //can also use 4 and 5
00051 
00052         toCanon.write("1\n"); //start interpreting
00053         //cout << "stderr: " << (const char*)toCanon.readAllStandardError() << endl;
00054 
00055         if (!toCanon.waitForReadyRead(1000) ) {
00056                 if ( toCanon.state() == QProcess::NotRunning ){
00057                         infoMsg("Interpreter died.  Bad tool table " + itool + " ?");
00058                 } else  infoMsg("Interpreter timed out for an unknown reason.");
00059                 cout << "stderr: " << (const char*)toCanon.readAllStandardError() << endl;
00060                 cout << "stdout: " << (const char*)toCanon.readAllStandardOutput() << endl;
00061                 toCanon.close();
00062                 return false;
00063         }
00064         
00065         //if readLine is used at the wrong time, it is possible to pick up a line fragment! will canReadLine() fix that?
00066         qint64 lineLength;
00067         char line[260];
00068         uint fails = 0;
00069         do {
00070                 if (toCanon.canReadLine()) {
00071                         lineLength = toCanon.readLine(line, sizeof(line));
00072                         if (lineLength != -1 ) {
00073                                 foundEOF = processCanonLine(line);
00074                         } else {        //shouldn't get here!
00075                                 fails++;
00076                                 sleepSecond();
00077                         }
00078                 } else {
00079                         fails++;
00080                         sleepSecond();
00081                 }
00082         } while ( (fails < 100) && 
00083                   ( (toCanon.canReadLine()) || ( toCanon.state() != QProcess::NotRunning ) )  );
00084         //((lineLength > 0) ||  //loop until interp quits and all lines are read.
00085         //toCanon.canReadLine() ||  
00086         return foundEOF;
00087 }
00088 
00089 bool gcode2Model::processCanonLine ( QString canon_line )
00090 {
00091         //FIXME this handles 3 axis code but that is not what is produced by emc2's SAI!
00092         //ideally, handle rapids (STRAIGHT_TRAVERSE) separately from STRAIGHT_FEED
00093         //for now, handle together
00094         if ( ! canon_line.endsWith(")\n") ) {
00095         infoMsg("Warning! Line " + canon_line + " appears to be truncated!");
00096         //cout << "Line " << canon_line.toStdString() << endl;
00097         }
00098 
00099         //a line looks like "   14 N..... STRAIGHT_FEED(0.0000, -1.0000, 0.0000, 0.0000, 0.0000, 0.0000)"
00100         //find position of N, save next 5 chars as the ngc line number
00101         myEdgeType edge;
00102         int N = canon_line.indexOf("N");
00103         //edge.N = canon_line.mid(N+1,5).toInt();
00104         //chop to N+6 (incl the space)
00105         canon_line.remove(0,N+7);
00106         //cout << "Line " << canon_line.toStdString() << endl;
00107 
00108         /***************************************************
00109         CANON lines that can be ignored are those beginning with:
00110 
00111         COMMENT SPINDLE MIST ENABLE FLOOD DWELL FEEDRATE 
00112         SET_FEED_RATE PROGRAM_STOP
00113 
00114         at some point in the future, it would be nice to 
00115         associate spindle speed, feedrate, coolant, and tool 
00116         number with the section of the model where it 
00117         applies, along with rapid/feed moves.
00118         ****************************************************/
00119         QStringList canonIgnore;
00120         QString ign;
00121         canonIgnore << "COMMENT" << "SPINDLE" << "MIST" << "ENABLE" << "FLOOD" << "DWELL" 
00122                 << "FEEDRATE" << "SET_FEED_" << "_TOOL" << "PROGRAM_STOP()";
00123         foreach (ign,canonIgnore) 
00124                 if (canon_line.contains(ign))
00125                         return false;
00126         if (canon_line.startsWith( "STRAIGHT_" )) {
00127                 if (firstPoint) {
00128                         last = readXYZ(canon_line);
00129                         firstPoint = false;
00130                 //} else if (last.IsEqual(p,Precision::Confusion()*100)) {
00131                         //do nothing
00132                 } else {
00133                         gp_Pnt p = readXYZ(canon_line);
00134                         edge.e = BRepBuilderAPI_MakeEdge( last, p );
00135                         edge.start = last;
00136                         edge.end = last = p;
00137                         if (canon_line.contains("FEED"))
00138                                 edge.motion = FEED;
00139                         else
00140                                 edge.motion = TRAVERSE;
00141                         edge.shape = LINE;
00142                         feedEdges.push_back( edge );
00143                 }
00144         } else if (canon_line.startsWith( "ARC_FEED(" )) {
00145                 gp_Dir arcDir;
00146                 gp_Pnt c;
00147                 double x,y,z,ep,a1,a2,e1,e2,zdist;
00148                 int rot=0;
00149                 x=y=z=ep=a1=a2=e1=e2=0;
00150                 
00151                 edge.start = last;
00152                 
00153                 //canon_pre.cc:473: first_end, second_end (two coords for end)
00154                 e1  = readOne(canon_line, 0);
00155                 e2  = readOne(canon_line, 1);
00156                 //canon_pre.cc:473: first_axis, second_axis (two coords for axis of rotation)
00157                 a1 = readOne(canon_line, 2);
00158                 a2 = readOne(canon_line, 3);
00159                 //canon_pre.cc:473: rotation, axis_end_point (last is third point for end)
00160                 rot  = readOne(canon_line, 4); //if rot is 1, arc is ccw
00161                 ep = readOne(canon_line, 5);
00162                 
00163                 switch (CANON_PLANE) {
00164                 case CANON_PLANE_XZ:
00165                         edge.end = gp_Pnt(e2,ep,e1);    /**** the order for these vars is copied from ****/
00166                         arcDir = gp_Dir(0,1,0);         /****  canon_pre.cc, probably below line 473  ****/
00167                         c = gp_Pnt(a2,edge.start.Y(),a1);
00168                         zdist = ep - edge.start.Y();
00169                         break;
00170                 case CANON_PLANE_YZ:
00171                         edge.end = gp_Pnt(ep,e1,e2);
00172                         arcDir = gp_Dir(1,0,0);
00173                         c = gp_Pnt(edge.start.X(),a1,a2);
00174                         zdist = ep - edge.start.X();
00175                         break;
00176                 case CANON_PLANE_XY:
00177                 default:
00178                         edge.end = gp_Pnt(e1,e2,ep);
00179                         arcDir = gp_Dir(0,0,1);
00180                         c = gp_Pnt(a1,a2,edge.start.Z());
00181                         zdist = ep - edge.start.Z();
00182                 }
00183                 last = edge.end;
00184                 //skip arc if zero length; caught this bug thanks to tort.ngc
00185                 if (edge.start.Distance(edge.end) > Precision::Confusion()) { 
00186                         //center is c; ends are edge.start, edge.last
00187                         if (fabs(zdist) > 0.000001) {
00188                                 edge.e = helix(edge.start, edge.end, c, arcDir,rot);
00189                                 edge.shape = HELIX;
00190                         } else {
00191                                 gp_Vec Vr = gp_Vec(c,edge.start);       //vector from center to start
00192                                 gp_Vec Va = gp_Vec(arcDir);             //vector along arc's axis
00193                                 gp_Vec startVec = Vr^Va;                //find perpendicular vector using cross product
00194                                 if (rot==1) startVec *= -1;
00195                                 //cout << "Arc with vector at start: " << toString(startVec).toStdString();
00196                                 edge.e = arc(edge.start, startVec, edge.end);
00197                                 edge.shape = ARC;
00198                         }
00199                         edge.motion = FEED;
00200                         feedEdges.push_back( edge );
00201                         chkEdgeStruct check = checkEdge ( feedEdges, feedEdges.size() - 1 );
00202                         if (check.startGap != 0.0) {
00203                                 exit(-1); //what SHOULD we do here?!
00204                         }
00205                         if (check.endGap != 0.0) {
00206                                 last = check.realEnd;
00207                                 feedEdges.back().end = last;
00208                                 if (check.endGap > 100.0*Precision::Confusion()) {
00209                                         cout << " with center " << toString(c).toStdString();
00210                                         if (edge.shape == HELIX) cout << " and arcDir " << toString(arcDir).toStdString();
00211                                         cout << " from " << toString(edge.start).toStdString() << " to " << toString(edge.end).toStdString() << endl;
00212                                         cout << "params:  e1:"<< e1 <<"  e2:" << e2 <<"  a1:"<< a1 <<"  a2:"<< a2 <<"  rot:" << rot <<"  ep:" << ep << endl;
00213                                 }
00214                         }
00215                 } else cout << "Skipped zero-length arc." << endl;
00216         } else if (canon_line.startsWith( "SELECT_PLANE(" )) {
00217                 if (canon_line.contains( "XZ)" )) {
00218                         CANON_PLANE=CANON_PLANE_XZ;
00219                 } else if (canon_line.contains( "YZ)" )) {
00220                         CANON_PLANE=CANON_PLANE_YZ;
00221                 } else {// XY)
00222                         CANON_PLANE=CANON_PLANE_XY;
00223                 }
00224         } else if (canon_line.startsWith( "MESSAGE" )) {
00225                 cout << canon_line.toStdString() << endl;
00226         }
00227         //the else if's below are to silently ignore certain canonical commands which I don't know what to do with
00228         else if (canon_line.startsWith( "SET_ORIGIN_OFFSETS(0.000000, 0.000000, 0.000000, 0.000000, 0.000000, 0.000000)" )) {}
00229         else if (canon_line.startsWith( "SET_ORIGIN_OFFSETS(0.0000," )) {
00230                 //this is a common canon statement. we are going to hijack it to produce a warning, because
00231                 //the data we're getting was produced with a format of %.4f or so
00232                 infoMsg(QString("Warning, input has reduced precision, expected more zeros: <br>") + canon_line );
00233         }
00234         else if (canon_line.startsWith( "USE_LENGTH_UNITS(CANON_UNITS_MM)" )) {}
00235         else if (canon_line.startsWith( "USE_LENGTH_UNITS(CANON_UNITS_INCHES)" )) {}
00236         else if (canon_line.startsWith( "SET_NAIVECAM_TOLERANCE(0.0000)" )) {}
00237         else if (canon_line.startsWith( "SET_MOTION_CONTROL_MODE(CANON_CONTINUOUS, 0.000000)" )) {}
00238         else if (canon_line.startsWith( "SET_XY_ROTATION(0.0000)" )) {}
00239         else if (canon_line.startsWith( "SET_FEED_REFERENCE(CANON_XYZ)" )) {}
00240         else if (canon_line.startsWith( "SET_XY_ROTATION(0.000000)" )) {}
00241         else if (canon_line.startsWith( "SET_NAIVECAM_TOLERANCE(0.000000)" )) {}
00242         else if (canon_line.startsWith( "PROGRAM_END" )) {
00243         //cout <<"Program ended."<<endl;
00244         return true; //true => gcode file ends correctly
00245         }
00246         //else if (canon_line.startsWith( "" )) {}
00247         //else if (canon_line.startsWith( "" )) {}
00248         else {
00249                 cout << "Does not handle " << canon_line.toStdString() << endl;
00250         }
00251         //cout << "Done with line" << endl;
00252         return false;
00253 }
00254 
00255 
00256 //read first three numbers from canon_line
00257 gp_Pnt gcode2Model::readXYZ ( QString canon_line )
00258 {
00259         gp_Pnt p;
00260         QString t = canon_line.section( '(',1,1 ).section( ')',0,0 );
00261         p.SetCoord( t.section(',',0,0).toDouble(),
00262                     t.section(',',1,1).toDouble(),
00263                     t.section(',',2,2).toDouble() );
00264         return p;
00265 }
00266 
00267 //read nth number from canon_line
00268 //when n = 0, reads number before first comma
00269 Standard_Real gcode2Model::readOne ( QString canon_line, uint n )
00270 {
00271         QString t = canon_line.section( '(',1,1 ).section( ')',0,0 );
00272         return t.section(',',n,n).toDouble();
00273 }
